Bacon Jam Burger

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the ultimate indulgence for burger lovers: the Bacon Jam Burger! This mouthwatering recipe combines the savory richness of juicy ground beef with a sweet and smoky bacon jam that will elevate your burger experience to new heights. Imagine biting into a perfectly grilled beef patty, topped with a luscious mixture of caramelized onions, crispy bacon, and a hint of tang from apple cider vinegar. Whether you're hosting a backyard barbecue or simply craving a hearty meal, this Bacon Jam Burger is sure to impress your family and friends. With simple ingredients like ground beef, bacon, onions, and a few kitchen staples, you can create a gourmet burger right at home. Get ready to tantalize your taste buds and learn how to make this delicious Bacon Jam Burger that will become a staple in your recipe collection!

Ingredients

ground beef

Choose ground beef with a fat content of around 80/20 for a juicy burger. For a leaner option, you can use ground turkey or chicken, but be mindful that they may dry out more easily.

bacon

Use thick-cut bacon for a meatier texture and richer flavor. Turkey bacon can be a substitute for a lower-fat option, though the flavor will differ. Cook until crispy for the best texture in the jam.

onion

Yellow onions are great for caramelizing due to their sweetness. Substitute with sweet onions (like Vidalia) for an even sweeter profile, or use shallots for a milder flavor.

brown sugar

Brown sugar adds depth and richness. You can substitute with coconut sugar for a similar flavor profile, or use honey or maple syrup, but adjust the quantity to taste as they are sweeter.

apple cider vinegar

This adds acidity to balance the sweetness. If unavailable, white wine vinegar or lemon juice can be used as substitutes.

garlic powder

Garlic powder enhances flavor without overpowering. Fresh minced garlic can be used instead; just sauté it with the onions for about 30 seconds to avoid bitterness.

salt

Use kosher salt for a better texture and flavor control. If you're watching sodium intake, consider using a salt substitute or simply reducing the amount to taste.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper provides the best flavor. For a kick, consider adding some cayenne pepper or smoked paprika, which can add depth.

burger buns

Choose brioche or potato buns for a soft, rich flavor. If you're looking for a healthier option, use whole grain or lettuce wraps for a low-carb version.

cheddar cheese

Sharp cheddar cheese enhances the flavor of the burger. For a different twist, try blue cheese or pepper jack for added flavor. If you're dairy-free, look for plant-based cheese alternatives.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Bacon

    In a skillet, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy. This usually takes about 8-10 minutes. Once done, remove the bacon and set it aside, leaving the grease in the pan for flavor.

  • Step 2: Caramelize the Onions

    In the same skillet with the bacon grease, add the diced large onion. Cook over medium heat until soft and caramelized, which should take about 5-7 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.

  • Step 3: Make the Bacon Jam

    Add 1/4 cup of brown sugar, 2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar, 1 teaspoon of garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste into the caramelized onions. Stir everything well and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the mixture thickens slightly.

  • Step 4: Chop the Bacon

    Chop the crispy bacon into small pieces (about 1/2 inch). Mix the chopped bacon into the onion mixture. This is your delicious bacon jam!

  • Step 5: Cook the Beef Patties

    In another skillet, cook 1 pound of ground beef patties over medium-high heat for about 3-4 minutes per side for medium doneness. If you prefer your burgers more well-done, cook them longer. If using cheddar cheese, place a slice on top of each patty during the last minute of cooking to melt.

  • Step 6: Toast the Buns

    While the patties are cooking, toast the burger buns in the skillet until golden brown, about 1-2 minutes. This adds a nice texture and flavor.

  • Step 7: Assemble the Burger

    To assemble your burger, place a beef patty on the bottom bun, top it generously with the bacon jam, and cover it with the top bun. Enjoy your gourmet bacon jam burger!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I know when my bacon is crispy?

Cook the bacon over medium heat and watch for it to turn a deep golden brown. You'll know it's crispy when it easily breaks apart when you touch it with a spatula.

What does it mean to caramelize onions, and how do I do it?

Caramelizing onions means cooking them slowly to bring out their natural sweetness. Cook diced onions in the bacon grease over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about 5-7 minutes until they are soft and have a golden-brown color.

What should I do if my bacon jam is too sweet?

If your bacon jam is too sweet, add a splash more apple cider vinegar to balance the flavors. This will help cut through the sweetness and enhance the overall taste.

How can I ensure my burger patties are cooked evenly?

Make sure to shape your patties evenly and use a medium-high heat on your skillet. Cooking them for about 3-4 minutes on each side should give you a nice sear while keeping them juicy inside.

What is the best way to toast burger buns?

To toast burger buns, place them cut-side down in the skillet after removing the cooked burgers. Cook over medium heat until they are golden brown and slightly crispy.

How do I know when my burger is cooked to the right doneness?

Use a meat thermometer! For medium-rare, you want an internal temperature of 130-135°F, for medium, aim for 140-145°F, and for well-done, 160°F and above.

Can I use different types of cheese on my burger?

Absolutely! While cheddar is a classic choice, feel free to experiment with other types like Swiss, American, or blue cheese to find your favorite flavor combination.

What should I do with leftover bacon jam?

Leftover bacon jam can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for up to two weeks. It’s great on sandwiches, burgers, or even as a topping for grilled meats!

How can I make sure my burger buns don’t get soggy?

To prevent soggy buns, make sure to toast them before assembling your burger. You can also spread a thin layer of mayonnaise or mustard on the cut sides to create a barrier.

Is there a vegetarian alternative for the bacon in this recipe?

Yes! You can use smoked tempeh or a plant-based bacon substitute to add a similar smoky flavor to your jam. Just cook it until crispy and proceed with the recipe.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

To make this burger suitable for dietary preferences, consider using lean ground turkey or a plant-based meat alternative for a healthier option. For gluten-free diets, opt for gluten-free burger buns or lettuce wraps instead. Additionally, for those avoiding dairy, skip the cheddar cheese and enhance the burger with avocado slices or a dairy-free cheese alternative.

Pairings

This Bacon Jam Burger pairs excellently with crispy sweet potato fries or classic potato wedges seasoned with sea salt and pepper. For beverages, consider an amber ale or a rich stout to complement the savory flavors of the burger. Alternatively, a classic cola or a homemade lemonade can provide a refreshing contrast to the richness of the bacon jam.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Bacon Jam Burger open-faced on a wooden board for a rustic presentation, garnished with fresh arugula or spinach for a pop of color and freshness. You could also serve it with a side of tangy pickles or jalapeños for added crunch and heat. Consider adding a drizzle of sriracha or a garlic aioli on the side for guests who enjoy a spicy kick.

#

Bacon Jam Burger

30 min
$12.5
800 kcal
Difficulty: 30%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

gluten

Dietary Tags:

gluten-freehigh-protein

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main CourseLunchDinner

Tags:

easyquickindulgentsavory

Description

A juicy burger topped with sweet and savory bacon jam, perfect for an indulgent meal.

Ingredients

  • ground beef: 1 pound
  • bacon: 8 slices
  • onion: 1 large, diced
  • brown sugar: 1/4 cup
  • apple cider vinegar: 2 tablespoons
  • garlic powder: 1 teaspoon
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • burger buns: 4
  • cheddar cheese: 4 slices (optional)

Date Created:

11/22/2024
